questions.title: My best friend, Connie
questions.content:
My best friend, Connie, is two years older than me. We spend a lot of time together.
Connie has long dark brown hair and her eyes are big and round. People say she is 1． and looks like a doll. When we go out, people often 2． that I am older than her because she is shorter and slimmer（更苗条的）.
Connie is positive（乐观的）even when things go 3． . Last week she got her examination 4． , which were not very good. I thought she was going to be 5． .Instead, she simply decided to do better the next time. Then, every day after class, 6． teachers are free in their offices, she will ask them for help.
Connie gets on well with others. Everyone in my family 7． her, even my younger brother. When you hear her laugh, you will naturally（自然地）laugh 8． . When I feel unhappy, I will talk to Connie and she will make me feel 9． .
I think my 10． with Connie is very valuable, and I hope we will always be best friends.

options.explanation: 根据下文“looks like a doll”可知，Connie长得很漂亮，故选B。
根据“I am older than her because she is shorter and slimmer”可知，人们认为我比她大，故选A。
根据“Connie is positive（乐观的）even when things go”可知，Connie即便事情不顺利也很乐观，故选A。
根据下文“which were not very good”可知，考试结果不尽如人意，故选D。
考试不好，通常会感到难过，故选C。
当老师有空时，她会向他们寻求帮助，表示条件，故选B。
根据“Connie gets on well with others. Everyone in my family”可知，Connie和他人相处融洽，家人都喜欢她，故选B。
当你听到她笑，你也会自然而然地笑，表示“也”，故选D。
当我不开心时，Connie会让我感到开心，故选A。
我与Connie的友谊非常宝贵，故选C。

questions.title: Friendship will come back
questions.content:
Friendship, which you think may have lost, will come back amazingly. I had a best friend 11． the age of 7. Two years later, her family moved to England. Before she left, she gave me a bracelet（手镯）which was similar to 12． . She said it was like our friendship. She also told me to be 13． with it and remember our friendship. She 14． that she would be back to visit me one day.
Years passed, 15． I never saw her again. I took the bracelet off, because I thought she might have forgotten me.
Guess what! All these years, our parents 16． kept in touch. One day, they decided to see each other at the city where we lived, without telling us. Later that night, when we met, we were both 17． , and of course, very pleased to see each other again. Then we talked about the things that 18． to us all these years. In the conversation, she found I wasn't 19． the bracelet she gave me, so she asked me why. I explained the 20． patiently. Then she said, "I promised you that I would come back, so here I am today. I always remember our friendship. I will do everything I can to keep my promise."

options.explanation: 句意：我七岁时有一个最好的朋友。A：通过；B：在……里；C：在；D：从。at the age of…，意为：在……岁，为固定搭配。故答案为：C。
句意：在她离开前，她给了我一个和她的相似的手镯。A：我的；B：她的；C：我们的；D：他们的。根据主语she可知，此处用名词性物主代词hers，故答案为：B。
句意：她还告诉我要小心手镯，记得我们的友谊。A：细心的；B：舒服的；C：个人的；D：好的。be careful with，意为：对……小心，为固定搭配。故答案为：A。
句意：她承诺说在某一天会回来看我的。A：同意；B：告诉；C：承诺；D：提供。根据she would be back to visit me one day.在某一天会回来看我的。可知，这应该是她的承诺。故答案为：C。
句意：但是多年过去了，我没有再次看到她。A：因为；B：和；C：因此；D：但是。根据前句：她曾经承诺我要回来看望我，可知，空处前后为转折关系，用转折连词。故答案为：D。
